Articles.Content:
Hi everyone,

I have some questions about techlevel that is indicated in GUI of some part. I took the example of a procedural SRB of Procedural Parts mod. As you can see in this screenshot i don't have the possibility to increase the tech level of the part (New save Sandbox mode):

Spoiler

In the same save always sandbox if i load an older ship from the common ressource (available for all save) i have the option to change it:

Spoiler

I think that there is something i didn't understand, and i need some help.

Thanks.

KSP Version: 1.05

 

Mod list installed with ckan:

Spoiler

(Semi)Saturatable Reaction Wheels (SemiSaturatableRW 1.10.2.1)
Active Texture Management - X86 - Aggressive (ActiveTextureManagement-x86-Aggressive 5-0)

Link to the output_log and Module manager configcache:

Click here to see a .rar with the output log and the Module_Manager_configcache


 

Edited March 7, 2016 by Thomot512
-Adding log, updating mod list, adding module manger configcache
Please zip and upload (a) your log (see the sticky in this forum for how to find it), and (b) your ModuleManager.ConfigCache from GameData.

Hi thanks, for the interest you have in my little problem.

I edited the main post to add what you asked. I added a precision. The ship that i loaded in which the Techlevel work come from the folder that allow you to use the ship in any save.

I updated a few mods but nothing changed.

I also remade a try just before copying the log, i don't know if it help to find the info for you.

And that log was right from after experiencing the issue?

Hmm. Nothing is jumping out at me. However, you have an *incredible* number of mods, so my suggestion would be to narrow down to just what Realism Overhaul directly requires, plus procedural parts. See if it works then. Then try adding mods back bit by bit.

You're right about the number of mods. But you know how it is you read about a mod and you want to try it, then you do so and you notice how good it is and you keep it and so on. Then you can't run KSP anymore so you clean it and it start again and again.

I'm going to try with a "clean" install and see if i can figure out where does it come from. (It may take me a few days because i have few spare time)

 

Edited March 7, 2016 by Thomot512

Actually it won't take long. I tried to re-install KSP. Launched the game once without mod to set my setup (resolution, graphic setting, etc...) took CKAN and installed Realism Overhaul with the depedencies and procedural part. Then launched and try it again : Same issue. I give you once again the output log, the modular config and the mod list if you have the time and will to look at it again.

Oh and i'm running KSP in d3d11 if it's of any importance.

 

Mod list :

Advanced Jet Engine (AdvancedJetEngine v2.6.1)
Community Resource Pack (CommunityResourcePack 0.4.9.0)
Ferram Aerospace Research (FerramAerospaceResearch 3:0.15.5.7)
Kerbal Joint Reinforcement (KerbalJointReinforcement v3.1.4)
ModularFlightIntegrator (ModularFlightIntegrator 1.1.2.0)
Module Manager (ModuleManager 2.6.20)
Procedural Parts (ProceduralParts v1.1.11)
Real Fuels (RealFuels rf-v10.8.4)
Real Plume (RealPlume 2:v10.4.10)
RealChute Parachute Systems (RealChute 1.3.2.7)
RealHeat (RealHeat v3)
Realism Overhaul (RealismOverhaul v10.9.2)
SmokeScreen - Extended FX Plugin (SmokeScreen 2.6.13.0)
Solver Engines plugin (SolverEngines v1.15)
 

Once again the output log and the Module manager config

Thanks again for everything.

Edited March 7, 2016 by Thomot512
Yeah, not seeing anything wrong. Really weird. I'll try to reproduce on my end. You might also post on the Realism Overhaul thread and see if anyone else is running into this.
Ok thanks that you tried. I hoped that i was doing something wrong and that there would be an easy solution, but nothing isbas easy as we hope. Have a nice day.
@Thomot512 apologies for the very long delay here, but I've been unable to reproduce it...
Ok, no problem. I noticed that if i leave le VAB and come back,i'm able to change the tech level of the piece that i already placed on my ship. Thanks that you tried.
